title: saw a rioter tweet about the boards
body: I saw a senior champ designer make a harsh tweet (which he deleted within an hour) about the boards and how it's negative and provides no value, essentially bashing the entire board and more importantly just insulting ALL the people use it. Really ignorant of the many players that look up to Rioters and show a ton of passion for the game. With a tiny bit of resolve you can push past the negative and distasteful comments and find many useful ones by people who want to genuinely help improve the game or show their support. Blows my mind how a designer would discard a place where he can get FREE feedback about the quality of the work he is involved with.

replies.body: I also saw the Tweet, and it's not even worth my time or effort to address all the ways that it was ironic, negative, and hurtful to this community.

You don't see the truth in it though? Boards is 90% negativity. It sucks for the 10% of players that make it a great community, (concepts and creations, general discussion specifically) but the hate threads, empty complaints, and toxic hostility are undeniable. 

Rioters don't even come around anymore to shitpost since Cactopus left :(
There is 20x more insight in your reply than what was in that Tweet

> Stopped by the league boards. Was immediately reminded why they're awful. Negative value for everyone involved.

> I miss GD

The boards is mostly hate threads now because Riot doesn't actually address the problems.

 People say:
"Ardent Censor OP, Riot please nerf", *Riot nerfs 6 months later*.
"Akali's shroud is really abusive and needs gutting", *Riot doesn't touch shroud*.
"Starting damage stats are way too high, nerf starting damage stats", *Riot does no starting damage nerfs*
"Mages don't have a real keystone" *Riot makes no real keystone*

And the list goes on and on about how Riot just completely ignores feedback. This has gotten to the point where the boards already know Riot is not going to listen to feedback, so in return they don't bother saying "Fix X", but instead say "Riot's team is a joke". Honestly, I don't disagree with the boards either. Imagine you're playing a game of League Ranked, and your adc is overextending constantly without vision, dying all the time. You tell the adc to stop overextending, but they dont listen, thus the adc ends up ruining the game for all 4 of your team mates because they wont listen. Which in return, turns you into a rather toxic player because all they had to do was listen.

Yup.  No surprise, though.  
Riot - "We're going to ruin the forums and create reddit like boards instead."
Nearly everyone that used the forums "Please, don't do that.  You have reddit for that?  Can we please keep our forum?"
Riot - "No.  We need to do this so that we have better communication with you guys.  Whether you like it or not, it will be better in the long run."
Community - "Well... we still don't like it, but if you insist."

Tbh, I can't blame him.

The boards are a shithole, filled with false information, blatant lies, ignorance, hateful speech, and sheer stupidity.

Sure, it's not all bad. But it's hard to enjoy a bowl of M&Ms when 95% of them have the chocolate inside replaced with literal shit, just as it's hard to enjoy the boards when 95% of the posts are full of shit (both in content and in truth).

You can't take it seriously when many posts are saying winrate doesn't matter **at all**, or when every other post is bitching about a champion that hasn't been meta for years, or when the users deliberately hide facts just because they **don't like them**.

And when a Rioter can't come to the boards and give insight on anything without being bombarded about irrelevant crap and being personally attacked...

Can you really blame him?

There's so little quality here. There's so little worth here. Yeah, you can get free feedback, but when that feedback is constantly contradicting itself **and is usually based on false information to begin with**, you really can't use it.
They let it get like that though. No communication here.

The only way they could "stop" it from getting like *this* is by banning literally everyone who was like that.

No amount of dev communication is going to stop people from lying, making shit up to suit what they want to say is true, hiding the actual truth, and generally being assholes.

Oh please the boards have always been negative. Remember when we had an assassin meta and everyone on the boards complained. or when we had a tank meta and everyone on the boards complained. Or how about when we had an adc meta and everyone on the boards complained. I think you can see what I’m getting at here. The boards are always going to complain.

The boards are always going to complain about anything, but the amount of negativity has increased vastly in the past year. Some guy a while back joked something about how the health of the game could be based on how many top yasuo complaint thread there were on the boards. Zero meant Riot needs to get their shit together. 3+ meant things were ok. Check the boards now.
The game is fine and better than ever. It doesnt matter what riot does, people will still be negative about it. Theyll just find a new reason.
And that tweet was 100% accurate. Almost 90% of the topics made on the boards are toxic garbage. I got no problem with someone speaking the truth about the community.

Gotta say the tweet was pretty frustrating to see while at the dentist trying to not be nervous by my appointment lol.

I acknowledge there are flaws on the Boards, there are things the mod team can do better. The mod team is full of unpaid volunteers, which means schedules are pretty chaotic and people do what they can. Any team of any type will have pros and cons definitely, but I think one of the best strengths of community moderation is the sense of community. We are players who love the game just like everyone else.

All we ask on the Boards is for people to not perpetuate negativity as we try to make the Boards as positive as possible. And though the tweet wasn't created constructively, we'll still do our best to take that information and improve the quality of the community here day in and day out.

> [{quoted}](name=Attysu The Poro,realm=NA,application-id=6heBIhQc,discussion-id=E6BeJEiw,comment-id=0007,timestamp=2018-12-02T04:29:52.094+0000)
>
> Tl;Dr **Too much to moderate, not enough mod time**

I can get behind this sentiment, tbh. I think that boards would in fact be of much higher quality if there were significantly increased moderation. Since we're all here, I can ditch my saltiness to offer some feedback that I feel would make things better. At least then this topic wouldn't be a matter of who agrees or disagrees that boards is ass lol

* Voting needs relevancy. It's been such a popularity system for years now. If you've seen me talk about it then you'd know my opinion on up/down votes: it should be based on how relevant a comment or topic is, at least in regards to discussing anything relelvant to the game, not just general meme posts. I also believe that a reason should be given for a person's vote, or else it'd just go back to the popularity grind. That would be more difficult to impliment than it's worth, though. If nothing else is considered, then at LEAST we can just remove downvotes. With the current system, the only things I ever see downvoted are everything someone doesn't like but makes perfect sense, such as "I think this near naked female champion is too sexualized". That should not be in the negative votes for any reason, and wouldn't be for any reason other than the fact that people like seeing a naked female champion.
* Boards needs a spam detector. Self-explanatory, really. I hate that I'll check boards and see upwards of ten posts about the same thing with no construction added to the topic. Everyone copy+pastes the same thoughts, and for what I've seen repeatedly I'm pretty sure it's because people believe that if there are a hundred posts about the same thing that means Riot is required to listen and make the change and if Riot doesn't follow those hundred threads then it's a bad company. That's the type of nonsense that gets perpetuated in Boards without impedement lol
* Resourceful citation requested. I'm still upset that there are people who quote a wiki page for patch notes even though we have a patch notes page. Fake news should not be allowed to be spread in a non-memed manner. There should not be a trending topic of "This rune is ass look what it does doesn't it suck?" yet everything said about the rune is incorrect.
* Is...is trolling reportable? That's an actual question lmao and if it's not, it should be. I've never experienced it here myself, but I've seen many threads where those who consider themselves "intelligent trolls" constantly bother people with irrelevant nonsense just because they can't convince a poster of something. All it does is frustrate the poster and ruin the quality of the thread and conversation.

Well, that's my construction of the day. It's too early for me to think this hard on stuff. Again though, I wholly understand that the mod team is both unpaid and busy, and that moderation takes time and effort that doesn't allow for constant activity. That's a major point that should be considered throughout this conversation.

The policy forbids employees from making Riot look bad, basically. It may get a pass since the tweet was quickly deleted, but I remind you that a Rioter was recently fired for violating this policy.

I don't even know why you think the insult's accuracy is relevant; it's still rude, which violates Riot's employee policy as well as basic social mores. It may be true that the Boards are in a pretty sorry state right now, but that's no reason for a Rioter to trash-talk LoL's official forum and its users. Are any of your friends or family overweight? Do you refer to them as "fatso" merely because it's true, or do you avoid hurtful, _non-constructive_ criticism?

I don't know why you think pointing out a flaw is an insult. That's a terrible problem with your thinking right there, and much of 2018 American society at that.

According to the tweet quote, there wasn't an insult. Boards was called awful and a negative value. Does that offend you to hear that this site is awful and a negative value? I'm not. My experience with Boards is majority a detriment to my overall League of Legends experience. Most of what I see repulses me. Are you offended by the fact that much of this site repulses and hinders me?

To answer your question, yes I do have overweight family members. Guess what? They want to lose weight. Guess what else? I do point out how and why they're overweight. And when I catch them going against advice that they themselves speak and follow, I do in fact say "See, this is why you're still as big as you are." What, do you want me to say "Great job you're losing weight!" or "Hey you're still the same weight! Great job!"

I think youre biggest issue is that you can't fathom the difference between insult and criticism. You can have critical criticism of something and not be insulting. If you feel insulted by criticism, that's a you problem.
